info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 1:46PM PST until January 16 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain is the main concern within a wintry mix of snow, freezing rain or sleet. Freezing accumulations of a light glaze (0.01") up to 0.1" possible. New snow accumulations of up to 1" are also possible, but up to 1 foot along winter Ridge and Yamsay Mountain. Winds gusting 25 to 35 mph over the mountains. * WHERE...Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. This includes Chemult, Crescent, Highway 97 across northern Klamath County and Highway 31 in far northwest Lake and far northeast Klamath counties. This also includes higher terrain in eastern Klamath and western Lake County. * WHEN...From noon today to 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wintry mix of precipitation is expected to change to a mix of rain and snow this evening and overnight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
